heading: mp3 squabble settles amicably
subheading: playmedia, which accused nullsoft and mp3.com of copyright infringement, drops its lawsuit as the companies settle their differences and conclude new business arrangements. by joanna glasner.
author: joanna glasner
text: music software developer playmedia said on wednesday that it has settled a copyright infringement lawsuit filed against mp3.com and nullsoft, which makes the popular winamp mp3 player. as part of the settlement, nullsoft agreed to license some of playmedia's mp3 playback technology for possible use in the winamp player. the companies didn't disclose financial details of the agreement.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
